StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [UpdateBilletDateHistory]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@PersonId int, @BeginDate date.me, @Enddate date.me, @E.ec.vedate date.me, @UserLogin varchar(15)
AS
declare @e.ec.ve_date varchar(20)
IF @E.ec.vedate IS NULL BEGIN --- UPDATE BILLET DATE IN RECRUITING PERSON TABLE IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM RECRUITING_PERSON WHERE RECRUITING_PERSON_ID = @PersonId) BEGIN UPDATE RECRUITING_PERSON SET BILLET_BEGIN_DATE = @BeginDate, USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GetDate() WHERE RECRUITING_PERSON_ID = @PersonId END
END
ELSE BEGIN
SET @e.ec.ve_date = CONVERT(VARCHAR(20), @E.ec.vedate, 101)
--- UPDATE BILLET DATE IN RECRUITER HISTORY TABLE IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM RECRUITER_HISTORY WHERE RECRUITING_PERSON_ID = @PersonId AND CONVERT(VARCHAR(20),EFFECTIVE_DATE, 101) = @e.ec.ve_date) BEGIN
UPDATE RECRUITER_HISTORY SET BILLET_BEGIN_DATE = @BeginDate, BILLET_END_DATE = @Enddate, EFFECTIVE_DATE = dateadd(ms,datepart(ms,getdate()),@BeginDate), USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GetDate() WHERE RECRUITING_PERSON_ID = @PersonId AND CONVERT(VARCHAR(20),EFFECTIVE_DATE, 101) = @e.ec.ve_date
END
END
